meanings.definition: Lying or situated beneath something else.
meanings.sent1: The roots of the tree are the underlying support for its trunk.
meanings.sent2: The underlying rock layer provides stability to the soil above.
meanings.sent3: The underlying reason for the cat's mischief was boredom.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an underlying current of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The underlying truth always finds a way to surface.

meanings.definition: Forming the basis or foundation of something.
meanings.sent1: The underlying principles of the constitution shape our laws.
meanings.sent2: His hard work is the underlying reason for his success.
meanings.sent3: The underlying theme of the party was 'celebrate life.'
meanings.sent4: Trust is the underlying thread that holds relationships together.
meanings.sent5: The underlying belief in oneself can lead to great achievements.

meanings.sent1: The underlying message of the story was about forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: His underlying fear of failure held him back from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The underlying humor in his jokes always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Love is the underlying force that drives us to care for others.
meanings.sent5: The underlying sense of peace in the garden was calming.
